titleStmt.title: Taʾāmra Libānos “Miracles of Libānos” / Gadla Libānos “Vita of Libānos” / Taʾāmra Libānos “Miracles of Libānos” / ʾArgānona wǝddāse “The Harp of Praise”

publicationStmt.publisher: Die Schriftkultur des christlichen Äthiopiens: Eine multimediale Forschungsumgebung / beta maṣāḥǝft

licence.p: This file is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0.

msContents.summary:
AKM-004α*: I) Taʾāmra Libānos “Miracles of Libānos”: 15 (fols. 1ra-11vb, 13r-16vb, 64ra), incomplete, some fols. misplaced Additio 1. AKM-004β: I) Gadla Libānos “Vita of Libānos” (fols. 12rv, 17ra-52rb, 55ra-56vb, 57ra, 58rv), incomplete, some fols. misplaced II) Taʾāmra Libānos “Miracles of Libānos”: 4 (fols. 52va-54vb, 57ra-vb), incomplete. AKM-004γ: I) ʾArgānona wǝddāse “The Harp of Praise” (fols. 59ra–63vb), incomplete.
Additio 1.
* The codex consists of fragments probably originating from three different manuscripts. In the present work these three fragments, considered as three separated “Units”, are distinguished between them through a different letter of the Greek alphabet which follows a common shelf mark (the one registered originally).

msItem.note: Some paleographical features:

- In the text contained inAKM-004α (s. above in “short content”) the scribe uses to exchange the laryngeals. You can notice it for instance in the word ጸሓፊ᎓ “ṣäḥafi” (“scribe, copyst”), present often in the supplication formulas at the end of each miracle. Here it appears written also with the laryngeal “Ha” (ሀ) as in 14rb (l.1), and with the laryngeal “Ḫa” (ኀ), as in 64rb (l.2).
Other example of laryngeal exchanging is the verbal form የሀሉ written here የሐሉ (e.g., 6va [l.18], 7vb [l.8]).
- In the text ofAKM-004β the letter “Ṗä” (ጰ) has the hook marking the sixth order vowel (ጵ) directed to the left (e.g., 19va [l.12], 22rb [l.17], 26ra [l.4]).
- In the texts ofAKM-004α andAKM-004β the punctuation used as sentence dividers generally is represented by the nine dot asterisk, instead of the four dot asterisk mostly used inAKM-004γ.
- InAKM-004α, the miracles are 15 (1ra – 11vb, 13ra – 16vb), and they are numbered. The miracles 1- 2 are missing and the miracles 7-8 are misplaced, as well as part of the miracles 6 and 9.
In the present condition of the manuscript, the actual order of the Miracles is as follows:
Miracle 3 (?): 1ra - 2va (l.8), beginning missing;
Miracle 4 (፬): 2va (l.8) - 3ra (l.12);
Miracle 5 (፭): 3ra (l.13) - rb (l.16);
Miracle 6 (፮): 3rb (l.16) - 3vb, end misplaced (in 13ra – rb [l.9], s. below);
Miracle 9 (፱): 4ra - va (l.8), beginning and part of text misplaced (in 14ra [l.15] – 16vb, s. below);
Miracle 10 (፲): 4va (l.9) - 5va (l.1);
Miracle 11 (፲፩): 5va (l.2) - 6vb (l.2);
Miracle 12 (፲፪): 6vb (l.2) - 7vb (l.9);
Miracle 13 (፲፫): 7rb (l.9) - 8vb (l.4);
Miracle 14 (፲፬): 8vb (l.15) - 9vb (l.13);
Miracle 15 (፲፭): 9vb (l.14) -10va (l.12);
Miracle 16 (፲፮): 10va (l.13) - 11ra (l.6);
Miracle 17 (፲፯): 11ra (l.7) - 11vb;
Miracle 6 (፮):13ra - rb (l.9), beginning misplaced (in 3rb [l.16] - 3vb, s. above);
Miracle 7 (፯): 13rb (l.9) - 13vb;
Miracle 8 (፰): 14ra (ls. 1-15);
Miracle 9 (፱): 14ra (l.15) - 16vb, the end misplaced (in 4ra -va [l.8], s. above).
- InAKM-004β both texts are incomplete and many leaves are misplaced.
The Miracles of Text II (52va - 54vb, 57rv) are four; they are not numbered. In the present condition of the manuscript, the order is as follows:
Miracle 1: 52va - 54vb, end missing;
Miracle 2: 57ra (ls.1-18), mostly incomplete, only the end is present;
Miracle 3: 57ra (l.18) - 57va (l.16);
Miracle 4: 57va (l.17) - vb, mostly incomplete.
55rv, 56rv, 58rv, containing part of Text I (Gadla Libānos “Vita of Libānos”: 12rv, 17ra – 52rb, 55ra – 56vb57ra [l.18], 58rv), are misplaced. 58rv contains the incipit of Text I.
- For the Texts of Gadla Libānos, Taʾāmra Libānos and Malkǝʾa Libānos compare them to the edited version: A. BAUSI, La «Vita» e i «miracoli» di Libānos, Lovanii 2003 (CSCO 595, 596 [SAe 105, 106]).
- InAKM-004γ, the text is incomplete and partly misplaced.
According to the edition P. LEANDER, ʼArgānōna Ŭeddāsē, Leipzig 1922,
the correct sequence of the folios should be as follows:
61rv: Sat. LVIII, p. 169, ls. 8-19.
Part of the text in 59rv is missing due to the present condition of the leaf (it is mutilated at bottom side),
61 is misplaced and the text in 61v is incomplete (lacuna in column b); in the same folio the list of names from ls. 6-16 is different from the edited version (s. above).

supportDesc.extent:
Made of 64.0 folios, of which 1.0 blank 64v, in quires .
195 170 55

list.item: The original structure of the quires cannot be established due to the poor condition of the Ms.

supportDesc.condition: The leaves of three different Mss. have been put and roughly sewn together. Many folios have been misplaced (esp. 12rv, 13r-16v, 32rv, 55r-56v, 58rv) some are still loose leaves (esp. 12, 17, 18, 32, 34, 45, 59-61), and many others are missing. Some folios are affected by humidity (esp. 59r – 63v) and some others covered with stains (esp. 2rv, 3r, 7v, 8r, 11r, 13v, 49rv, 50r, 52v, 53rv, 54rv) 12 is inverted. 58 is broken in the upper part. 59 is mutilated. The original bindings of all three codices did not survived.

handDesc.handNote:
Hand a (AKM-004α): fine. Hand b (AKM-004β): regular and fine. Hand c (AKM-004γ): neat and careful. AKM-004α: Black; Vermilion. AKM-004β: Black; red. AKM-004γ: Black; red. Takla KrǝstosTakla Krǝstos is the scribe mentioned in the supplication formulas of Texts 1-2 in AKM-004α (e.g., in 3ra [ls.11-12], 6vb [ls. 6-7], 64rb [ls. 2-3]). The handwriting of AKM-004β is similar to that of Za-Walda Māryām (s. UM-024 and other Mss.).Hand a (AKM-004α): 19th century (?). Hand b (AKM-004β):18th century (?). Hand c (AKM-004γ): Second half of the 16th century (?).
AKM-004α:
አ፡ for አሜን፡ (esp. 3ra [l.12], 9vb [l.13], 13rb [l.9])
አሜ፡ for አሜን፡ (esp. 7vb, l.9)
ዓለ፡ for ዓለም፡ (esp. 8vb, l.14).
For AKM-004α: The names of the donor (or commissioner) and the scribe; name of the protagonist (both Libānos and Mäṭaˤ); elements of the punctuation signs; elements of Ethiopic numerals. Incipit of each miracle: “Täʾamrihu la-ʾabba Libānos” (e.g. fols. 3ra [ls. 13-14], 4va [ls. 9-10], 6vb [ls. 3-4]) or “Täʾamrihu la-ʾabuna Libānos” (e.g. fols. 2va [ls. 9-10], 3rb [ls. 16-17], 5va [ls. 2-3], 9vb [ls. 14-15]). For AKM-004β: Nomina sacra; names of the donor (or commissioner); name of the protagonist (both Libānos and Mäṭaˤ); elements of the punctuation signs; elements of Ethiopic numerals. Two lines, alternating with black lines, on the incipit folio of Text I (fol. 58rab); incipit (two lines) of some subsections in Text I (fols. 21ra [ls. 14-15], 23rb [ls. 11-12], 27vb [ls. 1-2]); incipit of each miracle in Text II: “Täʾamrihu la-Mäṭaˤ” (fol. 52va [l.1]), “Täʾamrihu la-bǝḍuˤ Libānos” (fols. 57ra [ls. 18-19], 57va [ls. 17-18]). For AKM-004γ: Nomina sacra; the name Ṗāwlos (wä-Ṗāwlosni). Three lines, alternating with black lines, in fol. 61rb (ls. 6, 8, 10); one line in fol. 62rb (l.11).

Hand a (AKM-004α): 1ra – 11vb, 13ra – 16vb, 64rab, characterized by the rounded script. Some letters appear more angular, especially the loop of the letter “ˤAin” at the forth order (ዓ “ˤA”). The space between the individual letters and the lines is broad.
Hand b (AKM-004β): 12rv, 17ra - 58rv, characterized by a broad stroke of pen and by letters of equal height. The letters tend to square broad shapes, slightly slanted to the right.
Hand c (AKM-004γ): 59ra - 63vb, characterized by uniform, tall, slender and vertical broadly spaced letters.

list.item:
f. 64rb(below the text): Acquisition note. 64rb: ዝገድል᎓ ዘአቡነ᎓ ሊባኖስ᎓ ዘአንበሰት᎓ ዘተሣጠ[sic]᎓ በንዋዩ᎓ ክፍለ᎓ ገብርኤል᎓ ወገዙኒ᎓ ሕዝቅኤል᎓ ዘሰረቃ᎓ ወዘፈሐቃ᎓ ወዘተአገላ᎓ በአፈ᎓ ጴጥሮስ᎓ ወጳውሎስ᎓ ውዘ᎓ ለኩን᎓
64rb: This (is the book of) the Vita of ʾabuna Libānos of (the church of) ʾAmbäsät which Kǝfla Gabrǝʾel Wägäzunni Ḥǝzqǝʾel purchased with his own money. May the one who stole and erased and defrauded it be excommunicated through the mouth of Peter and Paul. The note refers to Ms. AKM-004α. It is written in black and by a recent hand. It is separated from the text through two parallel chains of black and red dots and nine dot asterisks in between.

- On 12vab (bottom margin) a beginning of a miracle followed by an unreadable supplication formula is crudely written in blue pen by a recent hand. - Crude notes in pen or pencil in the bottom margins of 19v, 20v, 24v, 25v, 26r, 27r, 30r, 38v, 29rv, 40v, 43r, 43v (washed out), 45r, 49r, 50r, 57v, 61vb, 64ra. Some others are between the columns and in the upper margin of 27v, in the upper margin of 29r, in the left upper margin of 41r and above Additio 1 in 64rb. - The name of an individual, Bǝrhāna liq ("Bǝrhāna, doctor"), is written on the left upper margin of 15v, apparently in the main hand. The name “Libānos” is written in black in the left upper margin of 44v (same hand as the text?).

binding.decoNote: Two wooden boards, possibly non-original (both cracked and repaired with threads). Two pairs of sewing stations.

There are no traces of any original sewing. The leaves (originating from three different manuscripts) are in disorder, part of them unbound and part crudely sewn together with different threads. In the centre fold of some quires (e.g. 13v-14r, 14v-15r, 22v-23r), small holes are visible, close to the head of the codex. The remnants of three different manuscripts have been collected and put together between two wooden boards.

origin.origDate: AKM-004α: 19th century (?) AKM-004β: 18th century (?) AKM-004γ: second half of the 16th century (?)

projectDesc.p: Encoded according to TEI P5 Guidelines.

person.persName: - In AKM-004α, Warada Qāl is mentioned several times in the supplication formulas in Texts 1-2 (e.g., 4va [l.17] and 64rb [ls.1-2]), together with the scribe. Sometimes only the first part of the name (Warada) is written, followed by a vacant space (e.g., 3rb [l.15], 5rb [17-18]). In Additio 1 (64rb) the name of another individual related to the church of ʾAmbäsät is mentioned: Kǝfla Gabrǝʾel Wägäzunni Ḥǝzqǝʾel (?; 64rb, 10-12). - In AKM-004β, [Kǝ]brǝnä Krǝstos appears in some supplication formulas within Texts 1 -2. His name is nearly complete only in 57ra (16-17). In most of the other passages where this person is mentioned, the syllable “Kǝ” is washed out or erased (e.g., 28va [ls. 6-7], 19va [l.19], 37vb [ls. 1-2]). In 23va (ls. 2-3) the entire first name is erased.
